title: Your pictures on the theme of 'reflections'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: 20mph: Wales first UK nation to drop speed limit from 30mph
description: Default speed limit in built-up areas in Wales reduces from 30mph to 20mph on Sunday.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How Brighton picked apart new-look Manchester United
description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy discuss how Brighton were able to exploit Manchester United's change in formation during their 3-1 win at Old Trafford.

title: Antarctic sea-ice at 'mind-blowing' low alarms experts
description: Missing winter sea-ice signals changes in Antarctica that could be "absolute disaster for the world", scientists say.

title: The Papers: Russell Brand allegations and 'crisis-hit NHS'
description: Most of the Sunday's papers focus on allegations made against comedian and actor Russell Brand.

title: Ireland 59-16 Tonga: Johnny Sexton breaks record as Irish claim bonus-point World Cup win
description: Ireland continue their winning start to the World Cup with a bonus-point victory over Tonga on a landmark night for Johnny Sexton in Nantes.

title: Barcelona 5-0 Real Betis: Barca go top of La Liga
description: Champions Barcelona open up a one-point lead over Real Madrid thanks to a 5-0 win over Real Betis at the Nou Camp.

title: Diamond League finals: USA's Christian Coleman beats Noah Lyles to win 100m title
description: Watch USA's Christian Coleman beat compatriot and current world champion Noah Lyles to win the Diamond League 100m final in Oregon with a time of 9.83 seconds.

title: Leicestershire win last-ball thriller to lift One-Day Cup
description: Harry Swindells hits an unbeaten ton at Trent Bridge as Leicestershire beat Hampshire off the last ball to win a One-Day Cup final classic.

title: The Libyan city that's become a barren wasteland with a smell of death
description: With lives in Libya washed away, anger mounts as people ask why they were told to stay at home.

title: Newcastle United 1-0 Brentford: Callum Wilson penalty eases pressure on Eddie Howe
description: Callum Wilson scores from the penalty spot as Newcastle beat Brentford at St James' Park to ease the pressure on manager Eddie Howe.

title: Wales 28-8 Portugal: Warren Gatland's side struggle to World Cup win against impressive Portugal
description: A much-changed Wales struggle to a bonus-point World Cup victory over impressive Portugal in Nice.

title: Rugby World Cup: Wales fans treat Nice to hymn in flash mob
description: A flash mob of fans sing Calon Lan on the street in Nice ahead of Wales clash with Portugal.

title: Manchester United 1-3 Brighton: Individuals have to step up - Erik ten Hag
description: Man Utd head coach Erik ten Hag says "individuals have to step up" after his side's 3-1 Premier League defeat to Brighton at Old Trafford.

title: Who is Russell Brand, the comedian and actor accused of rape and sexual assault?
description: The comedian, actor and activist has hosted programmes for Channel 4, Radio X, MTV and the BBC.

title: Spurs score twice in stoppage time to stun Sheff Utd
description: Richarlison scores one goal and sets up another as Tottenham strike twice in stoppage time to come from behind to beat Sheffield United.

title: Brighton up to third with 3-1 win at Man Utd
description: Brighton cruised past Manchester United at Old Trafford to hand the Reds their third defeat of the season

title: Celtic 3-0 Dundee: Champions go two points clear at top after three-goal second half
description: Celtic move two points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership after eventually overwhelming stubborn visitors Dundee.

title: Samoa 43-10 Chile: Samoa begin Rugby World Cup with bonus-point win
description: Samoa begin their Rugby World Cup campaign with a bonus-point win over Chile in their Pool D opener in Bordeaux.

title: Manchester stabbing: Nathaniel Shani was polite and caring - family
description: Nathaniel Shani, 14, died in hospital on Friday night after being stabbed in Manchester.

title: Laura Kuenssberg: Labour - damned if they dare, damned if they don't?
description: When Keir Starmer unveils a policy it is roundly attacked - is this the price of getting a hearing?

title: Libya flood: 'There's a smell of decay and death in the air'
description: The BBC's Anna Foster is in Libya, a week on from devastating floods in the region.

title: Singapore Grand Prix: Carlos Sainz on pole position as angry Max Verstappen qualifies 11th
description: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz edges out George Russell's Mercedes for pole position as Max Verstappen qualifies 11th at the Singapore Grand Prix.

title: Russell Brand posts video denying 'serious criminal allegations'
description: The BBC understands that a number of women will make serious allegations about Brand's sexual conduct.

title: Wolves 1-3 Liverpool: Cody Gakpo, Andy Robertson and a Hugo Bueno own goal seal win for Reds
description: Liverpool score two late goals to earn a come-from-behind victory against a battling Wolves side at Molineux and go top of the Premier League.

title: Lampedusa: Italy recovers body of newborn baby from migrant boat
description: The child's mother is likely to have given birth on the journey to Lampedusa, reports say.

title: Body found in search for UK fighter Daniel Burke in Ukraine, say police
description: Daniel Burke, from Manchester, had been fighting for Ukraine in the war against Russia since 2022.

title: Buckingham Palace: Arrest after man scales Royal Mews wall
description: An intruder was seen climbing a wall towards the historic royal carriages at about 01:25 BST.

title: Ukraine's Crimea attacks seen as key to counter-offensive against Russia
description: This week's attacks against Russian targets are part of increased efforts to cut supply lines.

title: American bully XLs would not be culled, says chief vet
description: Owners will have to register their dogs, Christine Middlemiss says, after Rishi Sunak announces a ban.

title: Actor Hugh Jackman and wife Deborra-Lee Furness to separate after 27 years
description: The Wolverine star says in a statement he and Deborra-Lee Furness will now "pursue our individual growth".

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Ireland wary of 'ridiculous athlete' Malakai Fekitoa, says Conor Murray
description: Ireland's Conor Murray hails the ability of his former Munster team-mate Malakai Fekitoa going in to Saturday's World Cup game against Tonga.

title: Dan Whelan: Irishman thrilled by start to NFL career after Green Bay Packers debut
description: Dan Whelan became the first Irish-born player to play in the NFL in 38 years last weekend as he helped Green Bay Packers beat the Chicago Bears.

title: Historic Ukrainian sites in Kyiv and Lviv added to UN danger list
description: St Sophia's Cathedral in Lviv is among the buildings the UN warns is at risk of destruction.

title: Boy, 14, stabbed to death in Manchester
description: Another 14-year-old boy has been arrested on suspicion of murder and remains in custody.

title: Ovidio Guzmán-López: El Chapo's son extradited to the US
description: Ovidio Guzmán-López is suspected of being one of the leaders of the notorious Sinaloa cartel.

title: Brazilian butt-lifts: Why have one?
description: Brazilian butt-lifts are the fastest-growing cosmetic surgery procedure, despite high risks.

title: Tube Girl: Who is she and why is she dancing on trains
description: Sabrina Bahsoon - aka Tube Girl - talks about becoming TikTok's dancing queen and inspiring others.

title: How I lost £120,000 to romance scam gaslighting
description: As a BBC drama about a romance scam airs, one victim details how she lost a huge sum.

title: Major UK methane greenhouse gas leak spotted from space
description: In a first for the UK, the methane was detected by satellite, bringing hope for curbing the greenhouse gas.

title: Store owner gets shoplifters 9 times a day and no police help
description: His situation is seen in small shops across the country, says the Federation of Independent Retailers.

title: US special counsel Jack Smith asks judge to place gag order on Donald Trump
description: The order, if approved, would set limits on what Mr Trump can say about his election meddling case.
